Description: A hollow terracotta figure of a Sothic dog, seated on a rectangular plinth with faint linear detail. A bulla is worn on collar. Two-piece mould. Micaceous red-brown Nile silt, much blackened by fire on left side.
Curator's comments: Published: H. Coutts, Gold of the Pharaohs, Edinburgh 1988, p. 93 [70]. Petrie, Tanis I, 46, frontispiece (no.2) Brissaud and Zivie-Coche - Tanis 1987-1997, (1998) p.127, 132, 159, [pls.22,23, 29].

Terracotta IV Donated: Egypt Exploration Fund. From Find 35 at Tanis, the House of Ashaikhet. This house is on the eastern side of the mound, east of the Great Temple, probably outside the great enclosure wall shown in Petrie 1885: pl. [XVII]. Roman, first or second century AD. Comparanda: Near: Allen 1985: nos 18 and 21, from Karanis, dated respectively to late third to early fourth century AD and third to early fourth century; Breccia 1930: no. 508, from the Hadra cemetery at Alexandria; Breccia 1934: no. 413; Christie's 'Sale Catalogue', 8 December 1993: lot 124; Schürmann 1989: nos 1237 and 1238, dated second to third century AD; Sotheby’s Sale Catalogue, 8-9 December 1986: lot 126; Török 1995: nos 280 and 281, both acquired in Memphis; Van Wijngaarden 1958: no. 90; Weber 1914: no. 427. Bibliog: Petrie, 1885: 46, frontispiece:2; Nachtergael 1985: 232; Taylor 1988: 93, no. 70; Schürmann 1989: 327, no. 1237; Favard-Meeks 1998: 127 and 132, pls xxiii and xxixa.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3707)
